meanings.definition: The state of being synchronous or simultaneous.
meanings.sent1: The synchroneity of their movements was impressive during the dance.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played with perfect synchroneity, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent3: The synchroneity of the twins' actions often led to comical mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: In the synchronized swimming competition, the swimmers moved with incredible synchroneity like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The synchroneity of the traffic lights made the drive smooth and efficient.

meanings.definition: The quality of occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The synchroneity of the thunder and lightning was both frightening and awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent2: The synchroneity of the clock ticking and the rain tapping on the window created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The synchroneity of the dog barking and the doorbell ringing confused the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The synchroneity of the waves crashing against the shore and the seagulls flying overhead painted a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The synchroneity of the fireworks lighting up the sky and the music playing in the background was magical.
